column4: sorry, I didn't follow all, but what errors do you get? (so what's your prob)
if you have a digital camera, take pictures :-)
so you have trouble installing Ubuntu? Or do you have trouble with the partitioning part?
that's the problem when I just join in ;-)
just type them in a text editor and then dump them to pastebin :D
but by now you should've defined the problem? 1. Does partioning work? 2. Does it install all? ...
partitioning = good (that's good). Install went OK (great). Gnome won't boot. Is that your only problem?
did you ever think it could be a corrupt CD? (happened to me once)
you could also download the Ultimate Boot CD (UBCD) and use the harddisk tools to check your HD and run Memtest (Just to be sure) or even a CPU burnin test :D
if you're on windows, just use Nero (or something) to burn the Ubuntu CD and then select "verify written data" (or something like that)
wait
FIRST get the Ultimate boot cd.... and burn it!
and maybe Knoppix too. Just to be sure
if something happens, Testdisk (UBCD) could save your behind and Knoppix could help you partition :D (it's faster than Ubuntu live CD :P)
I just want to give you a couple of pointers (things you should look out for). You'll never know
A friend of mine had install probs with Windows XP. The RAM was bad (wrong slot, so many many errors)
I also have a SATA drive (2nd or 3rd HD). Works like a charm :-)
SATA isn't faster, only smaller cables
Memtest could take up to 24-hours to run all the tests! I always do that when I get a new PC, checking everything so I don't regret it later on
UBCD is better. And it's proven
you still there?
one more thing. What kind of graphics card do you have??? (I think it was a Geforce 6800 problem, that Gnome wasn't booting). You'll need to search ubuntuforums.org
